Twin Peaks.name: Twin Peaks
reviews: The best way to end a great day in San Francisco...
is to watch the sunset at Twin Peaks. Arrive ahead of time because it gets pretty crowded. Bring a jacket, it is chilly no matter the season.

If you’re nearby catch the muni transport to the hill, otherwise Uber and lift drivers will take you there for more or less 10$. Best views of the city (especially the enlightened market st.) are around 5/6 pm, during the sunset hours. You can see the whole city downtown and uptown with the skyline made by the gg bridge, the trans America pyramid and the other iconic landmarks slowly fading into the blue of the Pacific Ocean.
Show less

The three best views of San Fran I love are Twin Peaks, Lands End and Dolores Park. Twin Peaks though is by far my favorite! Not a hike at all, just a small walk up some stairs and you can overlook the entire city! Amazing!!!

Rented a car for the day. Totally loved the views from TP. Walk from parking to the two peaks. Steep with gravel road and steps up hill. You can also ride bike / walk up the top and back down again.
Hint: bring water. No shop nor coffee on top.
Show less
In a city of great views, this was extraordinary!
It might be a little difficult to get up to Twin Peaks without a car, but if you can do it on a clear day, it is well worth it
Would recommend to do if you have the time and a car. Was able to go by Greyline’s “San Francisco city tour”.
Took an Uber from Castro. The views from here are amazing. You can see the entire Bay Area. With a visit.

Because of the circumstances of our trip we had all our luggage in the car. Be very careful as we went up one peak and lots of
people were around. My kid wanted to go up the other so we did. In between all the other cars left. On the way down from the second we saw someone breaking into our car. They got a small kids backpack but if we hadn’t come down then they probably would’ve taken everything. When they say don’t leave anything, really don’t leave anything in your car! Beautiful lookout point. Also be careful with kiddos it’s a bit hard to climb. 5 year old could do it but needed some help. I would love to hear that police are increasing patrols around here and other tourist spots because break ins seem to be very very common.
Show less
I suggest going at night so you can see the city lit up. Unbelievable all the glittering lights. The bridge is really amazing at night. This image will forever stay in my head!

We visited Twin Peaks at night by car. Just amazing views. One one side you have sunset views of the pacific ocean the other you have the nightime city views. It was cold in Feb so take a coat. Can imagine in Summer it would be cool.
Show less

I hiked up this mountain and spent about an hour here. Bring an extra jacket, even if it is hot on the ground because it can get windy, especially if you visit near sunset. If you have time to visit this mountain while you are visiting San Fransisco, do it!!! There is a bus that will take you directly to the bottom of the mountain. The view is truly incredible and breath taking
Show less
Check out the views and also read about the history. Another San Francisco site to visit and not to be missed.
Went on an organised tour and this was one of the stops... Great views from up there. There is parking but you may have to fight for a space. Awesome views on a clear day.
This place has the most beautiful views overlooking SF. Can definitely become crowded, but if you're able to catch it during the week for the sunset it's gorgeous and less crowded.
Location excellent at the edge of the gay district. Bartender very friendly and attentive but drinks very expensive ($11.25 for a draft beer and coffee) not including tips

We had very nice weather on our trip so we had some great views of San Francisco from Twin Peaks. We had been to San Francisco before but this was our first time to Twin Peaks, it is definitely worth seeing.

Came here at sunset. The placed was packed! Lines of cars and tour buses in every which way! People packed on the sidewalk all looking for a great picture of the sunset and view.

The drive up is winding and through residential area, so be careful.

We lucked out in that a car left their parking spot after only our first go around. Other cars were having to go around a half dozen times at least waiting for a spot to clear up.

The views are amazing. Such a great vantage point of a beautiful city and bay area.

Happy we made the trip.
Show less

This is a must! Best view in the city! You will be able to see how beautiful our city is! You will get nice pictures! This place has been known for car break ins so make sure not to leave valuables behind!
I love this spot one of my favorite in the USA, if you go to SF tu should go to here. amazing pics and free
truly wonderful big picture elevated view of the city. There was adequate parking and convenient self cleaning free restrooms
Parking is very limited. Recommend taking Uber or Lyft. A great place for pictures of the city and bay! Definitely a worthwhile stop if in San Francisco.
The parking was easy and the views are amazing. Plus a nice walk up the steps to the top of each peak.
World Class View of a World Class City

I'll admit a bit of a bias as I'm a native San Franciscan and live a short walk from this scenic overlook of San Francisco. But quite honestly every visitor to SF must experience the incredible views from Twin Peaks. (However this is a weather dependent attraction so if its overcast and cloudy skip it to avoid disappointment)

On a clear day you can see north all the way to northern Marin county, east to Mt Diablo and on a really clear day San Jose.

More importantly if you and orient yourself to nearly 80% of the entire city and get a good understanding of how the city is laid out.
Show less
drive up here ..... has to be seen
we drove up here i could not belive the 365 degree view we had very clear day 2 it was fantastic to see really really get up here
great spot on a clear day to see the city. From the Golden Gate Bridge to the southern side, you can check out skyline, bridges, and neighborhoods of Sf
Beautiful way to end our trip.

We had spent the 3 day in San Francisco. My cousin picked us up and took us to many places the hop on hop off bus didn't go. She gave us a grand tour and the last spot of the day was Twin Peaks. What a beautiful view of the city. If you get a chance, you need to go. It was a bright day without a cloud in the sky.
Show less

It was clear and the views of SF and the surrounding areas were amazing. Plenty of places to hike. Always crowded. A photographers dream place. Bring your telephoto lens. It is usually windy but not yesterday. It is a great viewing location in the day or night. Don't miss this unique opportunity to see San Francisco from the highest point in the City.
Show less
Bit of a hike but views make the effort worthwhile

Spectacular 360 views of San Fran and the surrounding area. One can drive right up to the peaks but is is more fun and a lot more exercise to walk. Police presence obvious and they told me they were acting as a deterrent to car thieves.
Show less
A must-visit place in San Francisco.

Even if you live there you should visit at least once in a while. The view is refreshing and exciting. There is some hiking in the area. One caution-- there has been some crime there, so lock your car and don't leave valuables in sight.
Get there early or you won’t get to go all the way to the top. Police close the top when it gets full.

Go right before sunset to see the colors in the sky (away from downtown) and downtown skyline. You can also see both bridges, but only the Bay Bridge is lit up at night.

FYI, you might want to go a bit early. Parking will most likely be a problem.
Show less

This is a popular location due to the great views, however crime has risen in the past few years. Watch your surroundings! Bring a friend or bodyguard if you plan to take photos with a nice camera. It is very difficult to get a parking spot. It is nearly always crowded. Also, the tourists and locals seem to think that throwing their garbage on the hill is okay. It is not okay!!
Show less
One of the best views of the skyline
I got a awesome view of the Skyline of San Francisco and there is a spot to take a pic where you look like your on top of the city. The neighborhood on the mountain is cool too.

Been here many times and never disappointed! My favorite times are sunrise and sunset. You must, however pick a day that isn’t too foggy or you can barely see anything. Driving and walking are both options, but it’s a long walk.
Finding the path upto twin peaks was difficult, as there were no/little signs. The view is excellent. Don't forget your sunglasses.

The road to the top is windy but once you have arrived, it is the perfect spot for the panoramic photo of San Francisco! Zoom in for the Golden Gate Bridge shot - assuming the fog isn't too heavy - or the downtown skyscraper shot. But don't forget to capture the full panoramic shot!
Show less

Not a bad view but there's really not much to do up there. I wouldn't necessarily recommend a visit unless you're in San Francisco with nothing to do. Nice surrounding town, however, which appeared to be quite a cultural hub.

Twin Peaks was one of the last stops on our honeymoon/vacation, and it was spectacular. Views as far as the eye can see. Absolutely a must visit while your in San Francisco. It tends to be windy and a bit chilly, so have a sweater or sweatshirt with you.
Show less
On a clear day, you can see much of the city, the skyline and the east bay. If you go at night, the view is nicer but watch your valuables. There are car break ins and robberies.
I loved what the Japanese tour bus driver did

The views are very iffy. Sometimes spectacular, sometimes non-existent due to fog. On one visit, the fog was dense as dozens of Japanese tourists streamed off their bus, with nothing whatever to see. The driver cleverly held up a large photo of what they would have been seeing on a clear day, and all the tourists dutifully took pictures of the picture.
Show less

No matter what the season, the views from Twin Peaks are spectacular! There was a bit of a line to park, but accessible parking was easy to find, and I was able to roll all the way around the walkway, experiencing amazing views of The City. Bring a hat and an extra jacket for the wind. (You're welcome.)
Show less
Easy hiking through the Castro, and great views

The best way to go to Twin Peaks is simply to walk from the Castro, taking the small streets and looking at the very eclectic architecture of the neighborhood. Then go up and up and be rewarded with the sidewalks are large at any point so it is rather safe with respect to the car traffic. This hike is also great for visitors to understand the topology of the city as it gives a 360 degree view.
Show less
A view not to be missed
You can see from the Golden Gate Bridge to the Bay Bridge and everything in between while standing in one spot - a true bird’s eye view. It’s worth the ride and or walk.

This is THE place to be in SF on a clear day, for unique views of the entire city. Don't even bother making the trip up the hill if it's overcast- you won't see anything. But on a clear day, you can see forever. And it is beautiful.
Show less
I was really impressed with the views from Twin Peaks and that SF hadn't allowed homes to be built at or near the top of the hill. Something's should be left alone and they succeeded!
Unbeatable view overlooking San Francisco in all its glory. Even in the fog it’s a wonderful sight to see. It can be very cold though!

Nice place to visit and relax when you are not in a hurry. Perfect spot to see the skyline of SF at night. Weather can be chilly at times.

Going out of here can be very challenging especially when you are just commuting via taxi or uber. No signal at the top!
Show less
Experience the exhilarating view of the peak!
Beautiful is an understatement! The twin peaks offer a magnificent view of the city, bay and beyond. Don't miss this when you visit SFO. After all, it's free. No entrance fees!

Amazing views. Gorgeous all around.

Was super busy at sunset. But absolutely stunning, definitely the most picturesque time to go.

We parked low down and walked up, was the best decision given the madness trying to find a spot at the top.

Toilets were reeeeally busy, I’d avoid if possible.
Show less
A must-do and free at San Francisco - best after sunset

The view from the top was magnificent, best some 30-60min after sunset, when some light remains but city lights come up. There are some parking around the lookout. A must do if you have time and a car.
There is no view anywhere like this view of San Francisco and the Golden Gate Bridge

I try to take guests to Twin Peaks whenever a visitor comes to town. They are all blown away with the 360 degree view of the city, the Golden Gate Bridge, and the Pacific Ocean. It's a little hard to get to, but one just needs to be persistent.
Show less
Twin peak romantic night visit - totally loved it

I visited the place with my wife at night - reading along so many awesome reviews about the place, and really what a view it was. You get a 270 degree of SFO City - will get too see the Golden Gate Bridge, Bay Island Bridge and the Entire SFO downtown - man the view a million dollar - you have to view in order to believe, see pics some glimpse.

You have to be though careful about the visibility and fog forecast - since it can get foggy suddenly, when we reached there it was clear and we got to see the whole city but soon after fog caught in and it became really dense with nothing visible; in fact while driving down it was difficult with visibility - so plan accordingly.

We are going to againin in daytime for viewing sunrise !!

Show less

Best view EVER..... i only give it 3 stars because you don’t want to go alone at night. Day view is the best when there is no fog. If you have a great camera night shots are perfect.... Just not alone.

As the song goes - 'On a clear day you can see for ever'

"Rise and look around you
And you'll see who you are
On a clear day
How it will astound you
That the glow of your being
Outshines every star
You'll feel part of
Every mountain, sea and shore!"

And from this vantage point you litterally can see one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

I love this view, and it is not something that you capture in a photo. To be there is to have the experiemce!
Show less
It was really crowded when we went around 2-3pm. But we would love to go during the night too! during the day the view is amazing, you should go!!

Long time visitor to San Francisco but first time ever to Twin Peaks. Actually I’ve never even heard of it but my son suggested we grab an Uber and head there. The views, even on a cloudy day were unreal. Breathtakingly beautiful. I can’t wait to go back before dark to watch the sunset and see the lights of tthe city! Next time I will do that!
Show less

Honestly if you don’t go your missing out. The views from above really put the city in perspective, make sure to watch for the fog as it can get very cold,windy and foggy (no visibility)

The views are nearly 360 allowing you to see the pacific, the bay, the bridge, downtown and all the neighborhoods. I always take my friends here when they visit.
Show less
The most completed 360 degree view of San Franciso and the Bay Area

Twin Peaks is situated where you get the complete panorama of SF/Bay area. Its a look out point so there is no picnic or area to chill out.

The drive up to Twin Peaks is really twisty, so if you get car sick be prepared. And if there is fog you need to postpone for another day. Also its windy up top so bring extra clothes if you get cold easily.

Other amazing SF view points to consider include:
- Bernal Heights ( more kid friendly, place for them to run around)
- Dolores Park ( picnic spot with the best view)
- Crissy Field ( for Golden Gate Bridge)
Show less
Lovely views of the entire bay area. Arrive before sunrise or sunsets. Amazing view of the whole city!

View the entire San Francisco, Bay, and East Bay from here. Always a great view. But beware of the foggy days. Although the last couple of years we have had noticeably less fog than normal. So you will probably have a great view!
Great place to visit. I have been here several times during different seasons. Christmas holiday time is definitely busy.
Fantastic views of SF, the Golden Gate Bridge and the Bay Bridge

We were lucky that we visited on a clear day and we had a fantastic view of San Francisco, the Golden Gate Bridge, Bay Bridge, Alcatraz, etc. Although it was a little cloudy across the bay, we were also able to see the UC Berkeley Campanile (tower). You drive up to the top and find parking (if lucky and patient) and can walk around on the top or walk over and take the stairs up to one or the other peak. The walk up the stairs is fairly easy with maybe 30-40 steps? Not many. But if steps are an issue, that's not a problem, as you get a fantastic view right from the top parking lot area. You also get a very good view of the Sutro Tower, which is fairly close by. Note: Be sure to bring a jacket. Also try to go to the restroom before visiting. There are restrooms up there, but with long lines.
Show less
great view of entire city of SF and bay

Drove here on New Year's Day, on our way home from last night's festivities. If you are headed towards the South Bay or Peninsula, a stop here is not really out of the way from the city proper. Views are amazing and can be done as quick drive through photo op with a few minutes out of the car.
Show less
Visited Twin Peaks with a tour group. Loved the views of the San Fransisco area from the top. It was crowded for the limited parking, so glad we were on a group tour. Take your camera!
This is the best view you'll get of everything in SF. We'll worth it, but only on a clear day! With teenagers I would plan for about 30 minutes here.
Drove up to Twin Peaks at night. Beautiful views of the city, and Bay Bridge in particular. We'll worth the visit.
I have driven up here many times and always marvel at the beautiful city of SF. I can be crowded and a bit chilly even in summer.
Recent tourists with obvious target's have been robbed. Tragically, one death. But SF POLICE have stepped up their surveillance. Please be CAREFUL and lock your car doors and enjoy the view
It was cold, very windy and cloudy so it was hard to enjoy this spot. We saw some views but it was to windy to enjoy hopefully next time
We drove up to the top of Twin Peaks, then climbed the stairs to the very top. The view of the entire city were amazing. I would definitely recommend this, especially on a clear day.
A 360 view of SF & the bay. Amazing sights, and it gets cold & windy sometimes. The bridges are really great to see from here.
Lovely view and free clean toilets at the Peak
Good view of the city with free, self cleaning toilets. Went there 4 years ago and now visiting again. Still love the view. Very windy, so bring a windbreaker.
The best views of San Francisco

By far the best views across the whole of San Francisco. The highest point of the city gives you sweeping 360 degree views of the place. You will need a car to get there - we took a taxi up and called for a taxi to go back down.
Show less
The Best View of San Francisco

We drove up to Twin Peaks with a Painted Ladies Vintage Van Tour. It was a clear autumn morning and the view went on forever. Our guide pointed out all the important landmarks. A beautiful experience!
If you have to choose between between Twin peaks or the Golden Gate Bridge definitely visit Twin Peaks. You can see almost the entire city from up there. Bring a jacket it's usually chilly.

If you have a chance and the weather is nice, try to go up to Twin Peaks. You will have a fantastic overview over San Francisco. Take the car all the way to the top and walk around and enjoy the fantastic view. It is a must doo.
Show less

This is a must see when visiting San Francisco. The views of the city are amazing and you can get a great feel of the actual size of San Francisco. The wind is always blowing and I would suggest warm clothing because it seems 10 degrees colder than the city. It is refreshing and uplifting to visit. Definitely clears your mind.
Show less

Beautiful views of the city, restrooms available and they have telescopes you can look through that you have to pay for. Worth the climb up the mountain (driving of course) although you see skateboarders flying down the winding roads. Loved it
The most amazing place that I see in San Francisco. The view is absolutely fantastic. Ocean mountain and a perfect view of San Francisco.

Great views of the city, but be prepared for people that stop their car in the middle of the road to wait for someone to pull out so they can get in, so you get held up for a long time in traffic, but if you have patients it's worth the wait to get to the top!
Show less
Most amazing sights of the city

Undoubtedly the best San Francisco city view you might get at the twin peak, only caveat is the weather shouldn’t be foggy or cloudy. On a sunny day, you will get a totally unblocked 360deg view. Getting there is easy for tourists like me.i took...More
Best vantage point to overlook the City
We stayed on the paths - didn't venture up the steps to the top points of observation. We were not disappointed but agree that the sunset must be magnificent from the apex.
A must see when touring San Francisco

Took my UK friends here when they visited. It was the highlight of San Francisco, outside the Golden Gate Bridge. It was perfectly clear and you could see forever in every direction. They were very impressed. Except for the view of Sutro Tower. They said...More
Stunning view of the city and bay. I was really lucky, apparently, because it was a perfectly clear day - no fog.
It was a bad time to visit maybe at 9 in the night. It was dark, windy and cold as ice-age. Winter wear dint help. Great view of the city.

My friend and I walked up to twin peaks from Mission and my gosh was it tough. Those hills are STEEP. We made it though and had a beautiful view of SF for 5 minutes before Karl the fog rolled in and his everything haha....More

It's amazing to stay on the top! There is observation deck and also you can go to one of the peaks (maybe both, I have not enough time for that). So perfect pics of the city you can take there. Must-visit place
Worth the drive up to get an amazing view of San Francisco. I don't think you really can appreciate the size of the place until you have a view like this.
Fabulous views!!! We walked the steps to both peaks and loved the views. However, the view is great even if you don't go all the way to the top of the peaks.
Great views of the San Francisco Bay; Be careful though around sunrise and sunset up there as SFPD are not always around to patrol.

One of many great places to go for a great sunset I SF. You get the city lighting up on one side and the ocean on the other. Finding parking is the hard part but we got lucky when we went. would definitely recommend it to anybody.
Show less

Well, it was a foggy afternoon, so the view was not as stunning as I'm sure it would be on a clear day. Since it was part of an overview tour of the city, that was fine, but if I were going there on my own or with friends, I would choose only sunny days.
Show less

Twin Peaks receives its name froma pair of 922-foot-high summits, has fantastic 360 degree views of San Francisco. The views are the best one will get in this city.

We visited during our fantastic city tour with Dylans Tours. You can also see the famous Golden Gate Bridge in the distance.
Show less

Wow wow wow. The view from the twin peaks is amazing. You must spend at least an hour of your day here at the Twin Peaks. They are amazing. Spectacular views. Be wary of valuables in the car because while we were there two cars got broken into. That's a general statement in SF overall. Its so cool to check out the city from the twin peaks.
Show less
Amazing Night View to all San Francisco

We spend more times on other attractions but at last time we ddecided to go and see it. All my family were surprised with the beautiful view. Its also a nice place to take pictures with couples, friends and family.
a beautiful view but sometimes in the clouds

My ex husband used to live up there so my friend and I drove up to just review old times and it was clear but the fog was coming in. This area of San Francisco has clear zones and fog zones so you might want to time your view according to what the fog is doing! But if you aren't fogged in, its a delightful expansive view.
Show less

My husband and I stopped up here one night..it was really dark, so walking from the car was a bit dangerous. (Never leave valuables in your car here!!!) But the view was beautiful. Definitely you need a car to get up here ..at night anyway. I suppose you could get up here by Muni bus but I recommend driving.
This is one of the ultimate viewpoints for San Francisco.
Show less

This is one of the things that you must do if you have travelled to San Francisco. The views are fantastic. The clearer the day the better, as the more you will see. The view across the city is amazing; you can see the Golden Gate Bridge, Ferry's at Sea to Alcatraz and so much more.

We took photos for others and the same was reciprocated. There were plenty of signs stating to be careful due to thefts and police cars were near by should an issue have occurred, but there were no issues on my visit.
Show less
Make sure you get up and enjoy these views. We were lucky to have a clear day so could see Golden Gate Bridge to transamerica and all down market Street. Enjoy the moment.

We were lucky to have a clear day, and do had great views across the city, to Alcatraz, Angel Island, GG Bridge. Beware if you need to use the restroom as they are self cleaning and take a while so you might have a long wait.
Show less
Breath taking view but dangerous for robberies to happen

I have taken people up to TWIN PEAKS for the view which goes on for many many miles . I took my brother up there when he visited me years ago from Georgia . He loved it . Just dont go up there in the heavy fog . Because you wont see anything . Twin peaks is also known for people getting robbed and their cars getting broken into . So if you went up here just be awareness of yourself and your car . Especially at night time . Sanfrancisco can be a very beautiful city to visit if you become very careful of the kind of people that are around you at all times . And i mean at all times too . Sanfrancisco has some of the best restaurants ever and some great book stores to browse in too . Just walk fast past all the junk souvenir stores and garbage t-shirt shops on Fisherman's wharf . You still could have fun here if you watch yourself carefully .
Show less

Outstanding view,a long as there's no excess of fog, and neat place to talk to strangers. Help take photos for folks and make it a friendly visit for everyone, it becomes so much more fun when you share a laugh with people.
Best place to see city's panoramic view

Want to enjoy last night of san francisco? This is the place to go if you are traveller. You can see golden gate bridge,downtown and even SFO(san francisco airport). Grab a coffee or tea with your favorite dessert from the bakery. You won't forget that moment even after your trip. Here's the tip for you: Try to visit there night time than day time. the view is much better under the moon. If it's rainy or foggy, I suggest you to skip to visit twin peaks. you won't have much to see. Enjoy your trip!
Show less
Cool place on top of the hill overlooking the whole city...u should definitely visit. The gps will take u there easily and u ll love it.. amazing views and super nice spot to make pictures...
Breath taking view of San Francisco

This is one of my favorite places in San Francisco. When you are at the top of Twin Peaks, you feel as if you are no longer in a huge city. It can be surprisingly absent of people. It is a fantastic spot to watch the sun rise or sun set. One can see the towers of the Golden Gate Bridge from the top of Twin Peaks. Make the effort if you are in San Francisco to visit Twin Peaks. You will not regret it.
Show less
One must take a tour of this site to see twin peaks. One can have a breathtaking view of SFO from this point which is on the hills.
If you do happen to arrive at this site on a clear day, make sure that your camera is available to take the full panorama view because it is truly spectacular...
Romantic place to go in the evening to look at the beautiful city lights of San Francisco. Don't forget to bring a jacket just in case it gets cold especially in the evening.
Twin Peaks what a wonderful place,,

We visited from Winston Salem, North Carolina, and Twin Peaks is a place to visit. The view is fantastic and you could see looking down the beauty of San Francisco in front of your eyes. If you visit San Francisco don't miss this wonderful place.
Amazing View of the City and GG Bridge

On the outskirts of town but easy enough to get to with a car. Parking is limited, but I was still able to get a space without too much waiting on a picture-perfect Sunday morning. Terrific views from several vantage points. Would like to come back for sunset the next time.
Show less
Great run from Mission district up to Twin Peaks. 5 Miles and 100 floor to climb. Good work out due to wonderful hilly San Fran! You earn the best view at day and night!
The sun came out and revealed the enormity of the panorama. It was a busy place to visit and you needed to be patient to get a good picture, but what a view.
Amazed at the magnificent view! Located on the fringe of the city so not a long drive. Bring a camera, iPad or phone as the panoramic view of San Francisco is unbelievable.
The views from up here are absolutely breathtaking. Come to see the sunset. You won't be sorry. Uber from waterfront is approximately $14 but the 3.5 mile walk is also nice if you want to hike up.
Well worth the hike up from Noe Valley on 24th Street then up the marked staircases. Each peak has its own views. Best to avoid the fog.
Great place to see the city

Twin Peaks is great, day or night. You can see the entire city from the Castro District, Mission, downtown SF, Bernal Heights, Angel Island - entire Bay Area is right in front of you. I suggesting walking the trail to each of the peaks, even the smaller third peak. Great place to spend a couple hours outside in San Francisco. Bring a jacket.
Show less

When not foggy, Twin Peaks offers a stunning and superlative view of the city and Bay Area. Really. But whatever you do (presuming you drive up), DO NOT leave your valuables in your vehicle. Car break-ins are rampant; it takes thieves less than 30 seconds to break in and make off with the "goods".
My husband and I regularly walk up to the top and almost every time we are there, we see chards of broken car window glass (if not the car itself with a smashed window).
Perhaps one of the reasons car break-ins are so ubiquitous is that the crime is considered a "misdemeanor". This, unfortunately, ties the hands of police. But for insurance purposes, particularly if you have a rental, make sure you report the incident to the police.
Show less
This is so worth the drive. Unbelievable views of San Francisco. It would be absolutely great to see it at night.
I took adults and teenagers to twin peaks. Weather was perfect and the views were amazing. Easy parking even during summer.

This is one of my favorite spots in the city! It gets super windy up there so take a jacket for SURE! My favorite time to visit is during sunrise! but the evening time is also great! you see all the lights in the city and the view is amazing!
Show less
We saved this for our last day before flying back. Parking is nightmare and take jacket its windy. Worth it though for the view and watching the fog role through San Fran

If you want beautiful panoramic views of the city then this is your spot! We take all our out of town visitors here when they first arrive, definitely worth the trip. Worth waiting for a clear day with minimal fog or smog to make the most of it. The views at night are also spectacular.
Show less
I live in Castro, so Twin Peaks is where I go hiking quite often. You’ll be rewarded with a great view. In case it’s not foggy, though.
Great place to visited. Superb panoramic view, from the peak you can view the whole San Francisco and Oakland. Must be visit if you are in SF area. It is family friendly place. Highly recommended!
Great view of city but beware camera robbers operate and litter a problem . Shame as it should be a must go to place.
From Twin Peaks there is a superb panoramic view across the whole of the bay from the Golden Gate to Bay bridges and centrally downtown San Francisco - brilliant for photographers !
Nothing to do with David Lynch, but incredible views
Long way up, but nice to see local buildings and become a bit jealous of having such a views. Great place to see sunset but beware of strong cold winds (even in May)
From the twin peaks, you can see good view of Sanfransico. You can see the complete skyline. Also, you can see golden bridge from the top.
Great views there over the city, Alcatraz and the Bridges. You can see along Market Street. It can get pretty crowded, a good spot for sunset or sunrise!
Standing as the second highest place in San Fran, your find this has become a popular location for tourists to take great shots of SanFran. Capturing the City and views of the Golden Gate bridge.
This place offers a very nice view of the city. I went with my friends in the beginning of September and it was very cold there. Some people were enjoying their dinner there with a nice view.

Taking a walk up to Twin Peaks is an easy way to get a quick feel for the geography of the area. There's space for parking at the top (if you've got a bunch of people, and a car, driving is the best way to get there). Tour buses also stop there. But if you're on your own, a simple, easy and cheap way is to catch the #37 Corbett/Twin Peaks bus at on Market St. at Castro and ride up to the Crestline stop (ask the driver to let you know when you reach that stop), then climb the blocked stair path to the Peaks (there's a SF park sign at the base of the stair path). The panoramic view from the Golden Gate to South San Francisco is spectacular. But as others have noted, it's often breezy-to-windy up there and a bit chillier than at sea level, so dress accordingly and hang on to your hat.
Show less

We hiked the Twin Peaks thanks to a friends suggestion and it was well worth the drive up and the footwork we put in. The views of the city are breathtaking, especially on a beautiful clear day. This is a must see!

Drove up here as part of our guided tour, but views well worth it. It is only a 5 min drive from a few main areas and the buses run to here. The areas of Castro and Haight are near to get a well earned drink if you walked up. Views are amazing
Show less
Stunning views of literally everything around. Twin Peaks is a MUST when in the area and does not take very long. Just soak in the views and reflect on life :)
We walked up to the Twin Peaks via twin Peaks boulevard. It's worth the hike, there are 360 degree views across San Francisco and out to the coast.
Great place to view the city, Golden Gate Bridge, the bay and beyond. Free parking. Highly recommend!
We went to view the city while on the sunset tour What a wonderful spot. Our guide grew up in this area and was fun to hear her stories of growing up coming to the Peaks.
A must when visiting San Francisco. Fantastic view over the city. A lot of people and busses, so come early
Great way to see the city.
You don't even realize how hilly San Fran is from up there. Beautiful views. We were lucky to have a clear day to see it all.

Take your camera the view is spectacular! Sometimes artists are displaying their work for purchase. After pictures, you can walk stairs to the top of both peaks for an even more view. The ride up to the peaks is also beautiful.

Don’t be fooled into thinking there is any other way up to Twin Peaks except by vehicle, either car or tour bus. It cannot be walked. Once at the top there is a 360 degree view of all of San Francisco. We were there in October a few days after the horrendous fires started up in Santa Rosa and Sonoma so the air was hazy because of the smoke. However it was still worth every minute we spent there. Wonderful view.

This is an attraction that is a must do event if in San Francisco. To be honest we didn't know about this one and with a packed schedule didn't think we could fit much more in. It was down to a fabulous Lyft driver who pointed after we discussed our plans that we might want to swing by this site or we would regret it. He wasnt wrong. After an interesting ride down Castro St home of the gay movement which is worth it to see a beautiful area with some very interesting sites we went up a very long steep hill suddenly we were on top of the world it felt as after a short climb/walk up some steps we could see all of San Francisco full 360 degree view. At night this place eould be amazing. At night though we were earned you have to be a bit more careful. But the views wete stunning and to see how the lay out of the city was fascinating and mind blowing. You had clear views all the way to Oakland which is in the other side of the Golden Gate bridge. There are some amazing home up there with views you would kill for there a few different areas you ate going to want to stop at.
Nothing more to be said than go do it.

Got up early and cycled up twin peaks to catch the sunrise. While on the best sunrise as the air was too clean! It was a beautiful sight to see SF slowly wake up

Go to the Twin Peaks to get an #Overview of SFO# No Jokes... Twin Peaks are two prominent hills with an elevation of about 925 feet located near the geographic center of San Francisco. The North and South Twin Peaks, also known as "Eureka" and "Noe" respectively, are about 660 ft apart; Twin Peaks Boulevard runs a figure eight around them. It was real cold up there… We were lucky to get a good parking spot… It’s so enchanting… Indian films were shot here… You don’t feel like leaving this place… Lot of memories bubble up to surface in such environs…

Was taken here as part of a guided tour, not much to say other then, what magnificent point to view San Francisco from, high up with uninterrupted views for miles.
Breath taking view of the city
You will get a wonderful view of the city including downtown skyscraper , the Golden Gate bridge and best of all, it is FREE.

Nice 360° view of SF!!!!! The only thing I could complain is that not a lot restaurant choices around the area and it was super cold and windy!!!!!!!!!! Make sure you wear warm clothing and scarf!!!!!
If you visit SF, you must visit the Twin Peaks..it's a great place to enjoy the views of this magnificent city..Be prepared and carry a jacket as sometimes it can be very windy..

If you only have an hour to be in San Francisco, you have to go to Twin Peaks and see the view of the City, the bridges, the bay. It is spectacular. It puts everything in perspective, and it is a beautiful sight. GO!
Un des plus belles vues sur SF / One of the nicest view on SF

Vite accessible, pas trop de monde et une vue à 220° sur SF et les environs. En plus, après, une petite visite de Castro s'impose.

Twin peak offers great views of San Francisco on a clear day or night. Half the time, the views can be marred by haze or mist so count your blessings if you happen to visit when the weather is good. We happened to be there on a clear night and the view of the city was simple awesome. Would definitely recommend. Parking can be difficult during weekends or on a clear day/night. Two restrooms are also available.

Actually it is one of the most popular places for touristic attraction, but even for local people there are many ways to enjoy the scenery from the sunrise to the sunset. Just 30 min. from the downtown.
The climb in your car is well worth the effort. When you arrive and park San Francisco will present itself as if on a silver platter

This is the absolute King of the Mountain experience! It’s Free, on a clear day it is breathtaking. I grew up in San Francisco and was lucky enough to see Twin Peaks everyday. You can reach it by car, a bus ride and short walk. The key to getting a clear view, if you see fog floating around 2:30 p.m. pick another day...I love these magical peaks, truly the best of San Francisco. Enjoy!

We stopped here with our tour group Dylans tours!!! Was a great ciew and so worth the trip... make a plan. Take great pics and enjoy!!!

We visited Twin Peaks during day time and were amazed by the view of the city. We could see nearly the whole city from the peak. You will need a vehicle to get to the viewing point as the climb is not easy.
Great views of the whole city. Fun. Does not take very long. Worthwhile. Windy. We found parking pretty easily.
Didn't know this area existed until took a day tour. Magnificent views of SF. Anyone visiting SF should go up and experience the views.

When you finally get to the top of the winding road, the view over the city is breathtaking. Thankfully we were there on a clear day which allowed for great picture taking and loads of people on bicycles, unicycles, (YES, REALLY!!) and walking.

This is a great place to get a view of San Francisco. If you have a car it's a relatively short drive up some winding roads. Be aware that it is quite windy up here. We were lucky enough to come up on a sunny day around lunch time. I would probably avoid the morning given the San Francisco fog.

It is well worth the simple drive to the top of twin peaks to enjoy the spectacular breathtaking views of the city and surrounding Bay Area. We've visited here twice in two separate trips. It's usually quite breezy and cool in fall so a light jacket is helpful. It also gets crowded and busy at time so be patient. You can beat the view from atop twin peaks, especially on a clear day.

One of my favourite parts of our trip was the twin peaks!! The views were absolutely incredible.
It takes time to get here if you don't have a car, we took the bus which drops you off right at the bottom of the twin peaks (the stop is called twin peaks) and climbed up from there.
It was super windy when we went so be prepared for that! There was a time I thought I'd actually get blown away and couldn't move.
We walked back down and then through the estate rather than catching the bus as they aren't that regular but it's far easier walking down of course.

The view is worth the trip up!

Must do! This is how we started our trip to San Francisco and you should too. It was kinda like an introduction to the Bay Area. Excellent views. We went in June, it was quite windy, so we had to take out jackets for the kids. We didn't have any trouble finding parking btw.

A place everyone should visit when in San Francisco. One has a great 360 degree view of the city from the top. Worth the drive.
Cool winding road with a great view at the top. Many car commercials are filmed racing around the curvy road. It was pretty foggy when we went, so the view was limited, but it was still very scenic
Just make Shute you not come there when foggy. It pretty height to walk there. Need a car or bicycle if you in very good condition

One of the endearing things about San Francisco to me are the fogs which can roll in and in minutes conceal all. This is the place to see it all happen, the high point of San Francisco. The fogs embrace everything with a damp kiss and are wonderful. Up here one afternoon, it started out clear and then silently but swiftly, the fog started rolling in and really, in a matter of 10 minutes, had embraced all once again. Quite an experience. But a great place to takes in the amazing views, however long they are revealed, and to contemplate.

Drive up the small hill and you are going to be rewarded by the fabulous view of San Francisco. There is a small parking lot.

SF is well known for its moody clouds which steal up on you any time of the day. Choose a bright sunny day to get beautiful views of the city! You can take your car almost all the way up, only a 2 minute hike up the top most point. Must visit!

Twin Peaks - The hightest poin in SF- used to be where kids went to kiss in the olden days. Best Views of hte Bay Area.

I lived in San Francisco for 25 years. Whenever I would get tired of the city and wonder why I moved there and fell in love with it.I would drive to the top of twin peaks and remember why I moved there. San Francisco has to be one of the most beautiful locations for a city anywhere. From twin peaks you can view the entire city as well as the pacific ocean, the golden gate bridge and down past the bay bridge. I especially like visiting when a heavy fog rolls in. There is no other experience I have found but when you find yourself enveloped by the fog drowning out almost every sound around you. I no longer live in San Francisco but I still make the trip to the top of twin peaks for this awesome experience.

We visited on a clear and sunny day so the views were amazing! You can see San Francisco in every direction. Don't go when it's foggy, though!

I had read about this online and thought it would be a good place to get a good view of the city. You can drive right to the top and park although there aren't a lot of spaces so you might struggle if it's busier. You can always park on the street lower down though but would just be a longer walk up. The view is fabulous of the city and great to take photos. Although the view is changeable, and changed with the fog even whilst we were stood there for 15-20 minutes, you can still see plenty.

A must see when vacationing in the San Francisco area. Excellent panaramic views. Can hike, drive or tour to the summer.
Must see while in SF, but on a clear day
SF is a beautiful city, and this is a great place to get awesome views of the city! Twin Peaks and the De Young observation towers are my favorite places for panoramic views of the city.

During a coach tour, our driver brought us all up here; Yes, the coach was able to get up here, and park nicely, and we all disembarked for a half-hour’s sight-seeing. Wow, what a view! You can see the whole of San Francisco from up here, and on quite a clear morning we were able to do just that. The view is so good, that the fog on the Golden Gate Bridge looked just like cotton-wool on a toy bridge, with the remainder of the whole area bathed in bright sunshine. One imposing item that cannot be missed from up here is the ‘absolutely huge’ telecommunications antenna that is situated on one of the peaks, looking remarkable like something out of a science-fiction movie; but fortunately, this is towards the rear of the sight-seeing area, so it does not impede your view of the City below. As stated, this area is accessible by Coach, Car & Bicycle, however, you can walk up here, but I would not like to do that unless I was an athlete; it’s a long way up. As far as I could see there were no parking charges and vehicles were coming and going frequently as all there is up here is the view, so when we had done that, it was time to go. It is worth the trip up here for the view, but only if you have the transport, otherwise it would take too long for just a short visit.
Show less
One can enjoy the great views of city from these peaks.watching sunset or nightlights is grand here.
I can't believe it took me 4 visits to get up here! Such an amazing view that it's hard not to get a little emotional up there!
Gorgeous views of San Francisco. Twisting streets to the top but well worth it. You can see the many Bridges. One of my most favorite places in sf. Romantic as well.

Our friend took us to Twin Peaks and unfortunately we could not see the view with the fog. Our friend told us that it's common so check the weather before you make a trek out to this place. The weather can be extremely different.
